algorithm:
Algorithm description: The new algorithm assigns scores to the bins based on the product of the ratio of the rest capacity of each bin to the maximum capacity and the logarithm of the item size divided by the rest capacity plus a small constant epsilon to avoid division by zero errors. The final scores are adjusted to ensure self-consistency by dividing them by the maximum value, and the output scores are sorted in descending order.

Code:
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    # Calculate the ratio of the rest capacity to the maximum capacity of each bin
    ratio_capacity = bins / np.max(bins)

    # Calculate the logarithm of the item size divided by the rest capacity plus epsilon
    epsilon = 1e-8
    log_division = np.log(item / (bins + epsilon))

    # Calculate the scores based on the ratio of capacity and the logarithm of the item size
    scores = ratio_capacity * log_division

    # Adjust the scores to ensure self-consistency by dividing them by the maximum value
    scores = scores / np.max(scores)

    # Sort the scores in descending order
    scores = np.sort(scores)[::-1]

    return scores
